articles.title: COVID-19 Vaccines: Appraisal of Indirect Treatment Comparisons
articles.contents:
NK Microsite Test

          About

            COVID-19 Vaccines: Appraisal of Indirect Treatment
Comparisons
          
          
            
          
          
            
            Project Overview
            Evidera and Pfizer conducted a feasibility assessment
            study to determine whether indirect treatment comparisons
            (ITC) between Comirnaty and other COVID-19 vaccines is
            feasible. The findings indicated that differences in key
            treatment effect modifiers between trials largely precluded
            valid analyses, specifically to Spikevax (Moderna). However,
            despite the recommendations to not perform such analyses,
            there have been several recent publications comparing
            Comirnaty and Spikevax.
            This project aimed to meet the following objectives: - To
            systematically identify all published literature assessing
            the feasibility of or reporting ITC results between
            Comirnaty and Spikevax. - To critically appraise the
            identified studies using the ITC/NMA study questionnaire to
            assess relevance and credibility to inform health care
            decision making (ISPOR Checklist). - To compare and contrast
            our own feasibility assessment findings/recommendations with
            other published ITCs with the option to disseminate these
            findings.
            
            SLR Results
            The SLR included 14 ITCs of COVID-19 vaccines. 
            
            
            
            Data Extraction

    src="https://nested-knowledge.com/embed/qls/6751" 
    height="600px" 
    width="1000px" 
    frameborder="0"
    allow="clipboard-read; clipboard-write">
  </iframe>
            
            
          
          
            
                
                  
                    SLR Protocol

Comparisons
